TopicTitle: Parts of a craft become dislocated after docking at a non-straight angle

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.1.3 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: windows | CPU: ryzen 7 | GPU: Nvidia Geforce GTX 1660 | RAM: idk

 

Was building a space station, and docked two parts together. The docking ports came into contact at a somewhat notable angle. This caused the docking port on the craft I was docking to (not controlling) to snap to the angle of my craft, rotating in place, and dislocating its orientation on the craft. Despite this weird angled docking port, I continued assembling the station and moved around a section to a different docking port. Once again, they came into contact at an odd angle, and this time the station became even more discombobulated, and more parts were dislocated and misoriented. I tried re-loading the craft, restarting the game, and my space station is still in this weird glitched position. 

Side note, a docking tool that helps you align your craft would be cool, perhaps it could be available on higher level probe cores or pilots.

Edited July 9, 2023 by Anth12

Reported Version: v0.1.3.0.24321 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: windows | CPU: ryzen 9 3900X | GPU: Nvidia Geforce GTX 1660 SUPER | RAM: 16 GB DDR4

 

I have had the same issue, no significant angle on intercept. The ship is still in one peice and the parts manager still has all the parts available and controllable. First and second image to prove I can still retract solar panels.
